poem:
### Data and Gold

In the wires' hum,  
the earth bleeds, unseen;  
men in towers speak  
of progress,  
their hands grasping  
black veins. The sky  
forgets the color blue;  
the soil yearns for roots.  
They chant growth,  
yet, in their shadows,  
life ebbs underfoot,  
a quiet, weeping echo.  
Progress, they call it.  
Profit, they know.
